name: Fall 2015
ical_desc: A series of talks and workshops on some of the most useful tools for advanced users and developers led by the Carnegie Mellon University Computer Club.
web_suggest: If you would like to request, propose, or volunteer a talk, join us on IRC or email your talk idea to operations@club.
categories: It's Dangerous to Go Alone, Take This

talks.title: Linux Containers
talks.desc: The new containerization technologies available in Linux are receiving a massive amount of hype. Learn why everyone's excited about Docker, and how you can use it yourself.

talks.title: Advanced Bash
talks.desc: Most developers and sysadmins and devops spend a lot of time on the command line. Learn how to maximize your effectiveness with bash - it's got all the cool features you need!

talks.title: Bash Scripting
talks.desc: Bash scripting is the classic sysadmin technique, but it's useful for developers and even casual users. Automate your computer and write simple yet powerful and useful programs, with bash scripting.

talks.title: Debugging
talks.desc: Learn the best techniques for expunging those pesky bugs from your programs!

talks.title: System Exploitation
talks.desc: Get a tutorial in how bad people and security researchers break your web app and make your life harder!

talks.title: PGP and Cryptography
talks.desc: Learn to create a PGP private/public keypair and use it for encryption and identity verification.

sponsor.name: Green Hills Software
sponsor.desc: Green Hills make the world's highest performing compilers, most secure real-time operating systems, revolutionary debuggers, and virtualization solutions for embedded systems.
